titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that the President of the United States should not proceed toward the normalization of diplomatic and economic relations with Socialist Republic of Vietnam until the Vietnamese Government has furnished a complete accounting of missing American servicemen in Southeast Asia and opened its archives to inspection.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Asia and the Pacific.

bill.summary: 5/20/1993--Introduced. Expresses the sense of the Congress that the President should not proceed toward the normalization of diplomatic and economic relations with the Socialist Republic of Vietnam until the Vietnamese Government has provided the fullest possible accounting of missing American servicemen in Southeast Asia.
